comments:
Background
----------
I was testing the patch for the PublishOperation sorting problem bug.

I am using the warm up I-Build of 20051020 as the target platform, with the
wst.server.core and server.ui imported from the CVS HEAD.

Problem
--------
I was getting the following exception when I try to start Tomcat 5.5, or Generic
WebLogic Server v9.0, and the same exception exception with our internal server
adapter.

Affected version
----------------
I cross checked that I-20051020 itself doesn't have the problem. 


Preemptive
----------
I understand that you might not plan to release the problematic code into the
real I-20051020. But, because of the seriousness, I file this bug.


Exception
---------
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Attempted to beginRule: R/, does not match
outer scope rule: Server scheduling rule for BEA WebLogic Server v9.0
at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:58)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ThreadJob.illegalPush(ThreadJob.java:117)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ThreadJob.push(ThreadJob.java:211)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ImplicitJobs.begin(ImplicitJobs.java:81)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobManager.beginRule(JobManager.java:190)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.WorkManager.checkIn(WorkManager.java:96)
at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.prepareOperation(Workspace.java:1674)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.build(Workspace.java:208)
at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:572)
at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:515)
at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server.start(Server.java:976)
at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server.synchronousStart(Server.java:1314)
at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.StartServerJob.run(StartServerJob.java:34)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)

If it helps, this is caused by the "ILaunch launch = launchConfig.launch
(mode2, monitor, true);" line of code in 
eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server's start() method.  Removing the "true" 
argument, present only in the HEAD version, avoids the exception.

Hi guys,

Thanks for the good catch. The change was to fix a request by Rob Frost to have
a preference (from debug) to build the workspace before launching the server. I
can't find the exact bugzilla right now.

It would be nice to have such a preference, but this change is obviously not
working and locking the entire workspace during server start as a workaround is
not an option since this would stop people from saving files while the server
starts. I have removed the change in HEAD and will not release it to the I-build.
This change is a bulk update of all _un_targeted, fixed, resolved bugs upon release of M5. This particular bug _might_ have been fixed earlier than M5. (Feel free to correct).
Verified problem is fixed. No longer see since Nov.
